description:
Hitori Gotou, “Bocchi-chan,” is a girl who’s so introverted and shy around people that she’d always start her conversations with “Ah...”

During her middle school years, she started playing the guitar, wanting to join a band because she thought it could be an opportunity for even someone shy like her to also shine. But because she had no friends, she ended up practicing guitar for six hours every day all by herself. After becoming a skilled guitar player, she uploaded videos of herself playing the guitar to the internet under the name “Guitar Hero” and fantasized about performing at her school’s cultural festival concert. But not only could she not find any bandmates, before she knew it, she was in high school and still wasn’t able to make a single friend!

She was really close to becoming a shut-in, but one day, Nijika Ijichi, the drummer in Kessoku Band, reached out to her. And because of that, her everyday life started to change little by little...

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: บจจิเดอะร็อก!

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Rotoscoping
tags.description: Animation technique that animators use to trace over motion picture footage, frame by frame, to produce realistic action.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hamazi__) | [Tumblr](https://akihamazi.tumblr.com/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5EeElPddQb5BMOHDXHxT5Q)

She is the older sister of the mangaka [Mameda](https://anilist.co/staff/290667).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kei_globster) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/kei_globster2) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@keirabat) | [Tumblr](https://kei1-glob.tumblr.com/)

Keiichirou Saitou is a Japanese anime director and animator.

In 2016 he graduated from the Animation Department of the Faculty of Manga at Kyoto Seika University. He can be recognized from his work directing both [BOCCHI THE ROCK!](https://anilist.co/anime/130003/BOCCHI-THE-ROCK/) and [Frieren: Beyond Journey's End](https://anilist.co/anime/154587/Frieren-Beyond-Journeys-End/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kafunsyokougun)

Animation Producer at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Started his career at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) as a production assistant on several series, already demonstrating his great penchant for scouting and fostering new talents. His first major role on an anime was as Production Desk on [Engaged to the Unidentified](https://anilist.co/anime/20483/) in 2014.

He left Doga Kobo in 2017 and joined [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/), later landing at CloverWorks after the studio became independent.
Originating from Studio WHO. Currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/plum30510)__

__Aoi Umeki__, alternatively known as Umeki, is a Japanese director, animator and storyboard artist.

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nara_kappa) | [Alt Twitter](https://twitter.com/narak0999)

Freelance Japanese animator and director. After debuting in 2012, he joined [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) in 2014. In 2020 he became a freelancer and would make his directorial debut on episode 6 of [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/WONDER-EGG-PRIORITY). 

Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/104990/), who isn't an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kei_globster) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/kei_globster2) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@keirabat) | [Tumblr](https://kei1-glob.tumblr.com/)

In 2016 he graduated from the Animation Department of the Faculty of Manga at Kyoto Seika University. He can be recognized from his work directing both [BOCCHI THE ROCK!](https://anilist.co/anime/130003/BOCCHI-THE-ROCK/) and [Frieren: Beyond Journey's End](https://anilist.co/anime/154587/Frieren-Beyond-Journeys-End/).
